result.execSummary:
The defendant Miguel A Gonzalez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Restitution set at $0.00.
Provide a DNA sample.
CONCURRENT to any other sentence and CONCURRENT to Count 2.

superMiscConds.notes:
AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety.
Random urine screens and breathalyzers.
No use or possession of any drugs.

Cooperate with the department.
Attend grief counseling.

CONCURRENT to any other sentence and CONCURRENT to Count 1 with 149 days credit.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Miguel A Gonzalez

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of Plea and Sentencing (35 pages) commencing 08-31-2022 by Lisa Diamond.

Defendant Miguel A Gonzalez in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court for Miguel A Gonzalez.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.  Defendant sworn. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:
Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  


Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded.

...
Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3.5 YEARS with 149 days credit, CONCURRENT to any other sentence and CONCURRENT to Count 2; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS with 149 days credit, CONCURRENT to any other sentence and CONCURRENT to Count 1; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.


Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.


CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety. 
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- Provide DNA sample.
- Complete 50 hours of community service.  
- Obtain and maintain employment. 
- No use or possession of any drugs.
- Cooperate with the department.
- Attend grief counseling.
- Driver's license revoked for a period of 6 months. 
- Restitution set at $0.00.


Court ordered the defendant to pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Court ordered that all court costs, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given.

OFF RECORD - Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case is calendared for a plea and sentencing hearing. Attorney Chernin is in trial on another matter. Parties notified of new scheduled date. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Miguel A Gonzalez not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Miguel A Gonzalez in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Miguel A Gonzalez in custody by video.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 037221,
Payable Number: 1000407,
Receipt Number: 22RP015585,
Amount: $20.00
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Miguel A Gonzalez in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Miguel A Gonzalez in custody.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Miguel A Gonzalez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
